children.subject: If you transfer as EECS, I thought youre given an extra semester? Meaning you'll also have Fall 2018?

history.content:
105 & 120 together is a good combo: they complement each other & will give you an idea as to what sub-field of EE you would want to study.  Adding 61c to that means you'd be constantly busy, but not overly so (since only 61c has projects).  130 is a fairly low workload class (the project at the end my partner and I finished in a weekend, hw takes around 3-5hrs, to only an hour if you go to office hours), so 140, 151 & 130 would be doable (just do not procrastinate on the projects).  140 doesn't really have much of a workload until the end of the class as well.  Based on workload, and how to best survey the field of EE, that's how I would divide my time.  One note however is if you can survive 4 techs, taking 130 with 105 means you would ace the device physics portion of 105 on the final (since 130 will spend an entire semester on it).

I do believe though you should have another semester... In which case, make sure to take 120, 105 & 140 before Fall 2018 so you can have a chance to take EE 142.  Hope that's helpful!

Another comment is that I believe 130 in fall is taught by Prof. Javey and he is very very good lecturer, totally recommend him over other professors.

105 & 120 together is a good combo: they complement each other & will give you an idea as to what sub-field of EE you would want to study.  Adding 61c to that means you'd be constantly busy, but not overly so (since only 61c has projects).  130 is a fairly low workload class (the project at the end my partner and I finished in a weekend, hw takes around 3-5hrs, to only an hour if you go to office hours), so 140, 151 & 130 would be doable (just do not procrastinate on the projects).  140 doesn't really have much of a workload until the end of the class as well.  Based on workload, and how to best survey the field of EE, that's how I would divide my time.  One note however is if you can survive 4 techs, taking 130 with 105 means you would ace the device physics portion of 105 on the final (since 130 will spend an entire semester on it).

I do believe though you should have another semester... In which case, make sure to take 120, 105 & 140 before Fall 2018 so you can have a chance to take EE 142.  Hope that's helpful!

children.subject: Thank you Rohit and anon. I appreciate the advice

history.content:
I am a rising senior this fall, and was a junior transfer in EECS. As such, I have to squeeze 5 EECS upper divs into my last year. As of right now, I am planning on doing

Fall: EE105, EE120, CS61C

Spring: EECS151, EE140

But this is not enough upper div units to graduate, so I want to fit EE130 (or another class, I am open to suggestions) into one of these semesters. I have some understanding of the 105 material already, and was currently planning on fitting 130 into fall. I know 151 and 140 are both heavy workload, and I would like to be able to focus on their projects, but it may be easier overall to fit 130 into spring. 

If anyone has experience in these classes and can advise, I would appreciate it.
history.subject: Which of these seems more doable?
